2694 * about the line will be wrong.
2695 */
2696 tp = TAILQ_FIRST(tiqh);
2697
2698 if (LF_ISSET(TXT_AUTOINDENT))
2699 txt_ai_resolve(sp, tp, &changed);
2700 else
2701 changed = 0;
2702 if (db_set(sp, tp->lno, tp->lb, tp->len) ||
2703 (changed && vs_change(sp, tp->lno, LINE_RESET)))
2704 return (1);
2705
2706 for (lno = tp->lno; (tp = TAILQ_NEXT(tp, q)) != NULL; ++lno) {
2707 if (LF_ISSET(TXT_AUTOINDENT))
2708 txt_ai_resolve(sp, tp, &changed);
2709 else
2710 changed = 0;
2711 if (db_append(sp, 0, lno, tp->lb, tp->len) ||
2712 (changed && vs_change(sp, tp->lno, LINE_RESET)))
2713 return (1);
2714 }
2715
2716 /*
2717 * Clear the input flag, the look-aside buffer is no longer valid.
2718 * Has to be done as part of text resolution, or upon return we'll
2719 * be looking at incorrect data.
2720 */
2721 F_CLR(sp, SC_TINPUT);
2722
2723 return (0);
2724}
2725
2726/*
2727 * txt_showmatch --
2728 * Show a character match.
2729 *
2730 * !!!
2731 * Historic vi tried to display matches even in the :colon command line.
2732 * I think not.
2733 */
2734static int
2735txt_showmatch(SCR *sp, TEXT *tp)
2736{
2737 VCS cs;
2738 MARK m;
2739 int cnt, endc, startc;
2740
2741 /*
2742 * Do a refresh first, in case we haven't done one in awhile,
2743 * so the user can see what we're complaining about.
2744 */
2745 UPDATE_POSITION(sp, tp);
2746 if (vs_refresh(sp, 1))
2747 return (1);
2748
2749 /*
2750 * We don't display the match if it's not on the screen. Find
2751 * out what the first character on the screen is.
2752 */
2753 if (vs_sm_position(sp, &m, 0, P_TOP))
2754 return (1);
2755
2756 /* Initialize the getc() interface. */
2757 cs.cs_lno = tp->lno;
2758 cs.cs_cno = tp->cno - 1;
2759 if (cs_init(sp, &cs))
2760 return (1);
2761 startc = (endc = cs.cs_ch) == ')' ? '(' : '{';
2762
2763 /* Search for the match. */
2764 for (cnt = 1;;) {
2765 if (cs_prev(sp, &cs))
2766 return (1);
2767 if (cs.cs_flags != 0) {
2768 if (cs.cs_flags == CS_EOF || cs.cs_flags == CS_SOF) {
2769 msgq(sp, M_BERR,
2770 "Unmatched %s", KEY_NAME(sp, endc));
2771 return (0);
2772 }
2773 continue;
2774 }
2775 if (cs.cs_ch == endc)
2776 ++cnt;
2777 else if (cs.cs_ch == startc && --cnt == 0)
2778 break;
2779 }
2780
2781 /* If the match is on the screen, move to it. */
2782 if (cs.cs_lno < m.lno || (cs.cs_lno == m.lno && cs.cs_cno < m.cno))
2783 return (0);
2784 sp->lno = cs.cs_lno;
2785 sp->cno = cs.cs_cno;
2786 if (vs_refresh(sp, 1))
2787 return (1);
2788
2789 /* Wait for timeout or character arrival. */
2790 return (v_event_get(sp,
2791 NULL, O_VAL(sp, O_MATCHTIME) * 100, EC_TIMEOUT));
2792}
2793
2794/*
2795 * txt_margin --
2796 * Handle margin wrap.
2797 */
2798static int
2799txt_margin(SCR *sp, TEXT *tp, TEXT *wmtp, int *didbreak, u_int32_t flags)
2800{
2801 size_t len, off;
2802 CHAR_T *p;
2803
2804 /* Find the nearest previous blank. */
2805 for (off = tp->cno - 1, p = tp->lb + off, len = 0;; --off, --p, ++len) {
2806 if (ISBLANK((UCHAR_T)*p)) {
2807 break;
2808 }
2809
2810 /*
2811 * If reach the start of the line, there's nowhere to break.
2812 *
2813 * !!!
2814 * Historic vi belled each time a character was entered after
2815 * crossing the margin until a space was entered which could
2816 * be used to break the line. I don't as it tends to wake the
2817 * cats.
2818 */
2819 if (off == tp->ai || off == tp->offset) {
2820 *didbreak = 0;
2821 return (0);
2822 }
2823 }
2824
2825 /*
2826 * Store saved information about the rest of the line in the
2827 * wrapmargin TEXT structure.
2828 *
2829 * !!!
2830 * The offset field holds the length of the current characters
2831 * that the user entered, but which are getting split to the new
2832 * line -- it's going to be used to set the cursor value when we
2833 * move to the new line.
2834 */
2835 wmtp->lb = p + 1;
2836 wmtp->offset = len;
2837 wmtp->insert = LF_ISSET(TXT_APPENDEOL) ? tp->insert - 1 : tp->insert;
2838 wmtp->owrite = tp->owrite;
2839
2840 /* Correct current bookkeeping information. */
2841 tp->cno -= len;
2842 if (LF_ISSET(TXT_APPENDEOL)) {
2843 tp->len -= len + tp->owrite + (tp->insert - 1);
2844 tp->insert = 1;
2845 } else {
2846 tp->len -= len + tp->owrite + tp->insert;
2847 tp->insert = 0;
2848 }
2849 tp->owrite = 0;
2850
2851 /*
2852 * !!!
2853 * Delete any trailing whitespace from the current line.
2854 */
2855 for (;; --p, --off) {
2856 if (!ISBLANK((UCHAR_T)*p))
2857 break;
2858 --tp->cno;
2859 --tp->len;
2860 if (off == tp->ai || off == tp->offset)
2861 break;
2862 }
2863 *didbreak = 1;
2864 return (0);
2865}
2866
2867/*
2868 * txt_Rresolve --
2869 * Resolve the input line for the 'R' command.
2870 */
2871static void
2872txt_Rresolve(SCR *sp, TEXTH *tiqh, TEXT *tp, const size_t orig_len)
2873{
2874 TEXT *ttp;
2875 size_t input_len, retain;
2876 CHAR_T *p;
2877
2878 /*
2879 * Check to make sure that the cursor hasn't moved beyond
2880 * the end of the line.
2881 */
2882 if (tp->owrite == 0)
2883 return;
2884
2885 /*
2886 * Calculate how many characters the user has entered,
2887 * plus the blanks erased by <carriage-return>/<newline>s.
2888 */
2889 for (ttp = TAILQ_FIRST(tiqh), input_len = 0;;) {
2890 input_len += ttp == tp ? tp->cno : ttp->len + ttp->R_erase;
2891 if ((ttp = TAILQ_NEXT(ttp, q)) == NULL)
2892 break;
2893 }
2894
2895 /*
2896 * If the user has entered less characters than the original line
2897 * was long, restore any overwriteable characters to the original
2898 * characters. These characters are entered as "insert characters",
2899 * because they're after the cursor and we don't want to lose them.
2900 * (This is okay because the R command has no insert characters.)
2901 * We set owrite to 0 so that the insert characters don't get copied
2902 * to somewhere else, which means that the line and the length have
2903 * to be adjusted here as well.
2904 *
2905 * We have to retrieve the original line because the original pinned
2906 * page has long since been discarded. If it doesn't exist, that's
2907 * okay, the user just extended the file.
2908 */
2909 if (input_len < orig_len) {
2910 retain = MIN(tp->owrite, orig_len - input_len);
2911 if (db_get(sp,
2912 TAILQ_FIRST(tiqh)->lno, DBG_FATAL | DBG_NOCACHE, &p, NULL))
2913 return;
2914 MEMCPYW(tp->lb + tp->cno, p + input_len, retain);
2915 tp->len -= tp->owrite - retain;
2916 tp->owrite = 0;
2917 tp->insert += retain;
2918 }
2919}
2920
2921/*
2922 * txt_nomorech --
2923 * No more characters message.
2924 */
2925static void
2926txt_nomorech(SCR *sp)
2927{
2928 msgq(sp, M_BERR, "194|No more characters to erase");
2929}
